radiographic_examinations.findings: Increased uptake in the proximal left femur, corresponding to a 3.5 cm well defined lytic lesion arising within the medullary cavity.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The metastatic lesion in the femur remained unchanged.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Uptake in the liver, left femur, and posterior mediastinum near the aortic arch.
A 2-cm nodule inferior to the right pulmonary artery.
A large hypervascular lobulated mass in the caudate and right lobes of the liver, causing complete occlusion of the vena cava.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No pronounced change in size of the mass compared with the size seen on previous computerized images obtained over 22 yr.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A 2-cm mass within the superior right aspect of the body of vertebra L3 consistent with metastatic disease.
Two masses (1.7 and 1.5 cm) at the level of the right renal vein.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A CT scan performed 1 yr postoperatively showed no evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease.
